name: Toilet Paper Stacker [Commodore 64]
description:
This game works on PAL and NTSC machines

Toilet Paper Stacker is a funny Lockdown themed score attack game, written for the CSDB Lockdown Fun Compo in March 2020.

This release should not be taken too seriously, as it was only made for fun.

Your Commodore 64 has contracted a deadly COVID-64 virus, which has been encased and quarantined inside a glass cabinet. The virus must be destroyed. Luckily you have oversized rolls of toilet paper, which you pinched (or perhaps borrowed) from your local bogs, as the supermarkets and medicine stores had completely run out of stock.

Your task is to drop the toilet paper on to the cabinet, and stack each roll accurately in order to force more weight at the top. Once 7 rolls have been stacked, the weight of the cabinet will be too weak to hold the rolls, the glass will break, and the virus gets destroyed.

For every successful toilet roll stacked, you will get 300 points. If you kill the virus, by stacking up 7 toilet rolls you will get a BIG BONUS added to your score.

You have five minutes to rake in as many points as you possibly can, unless of course you drop a roll on to the ground, which results in losing a chance. Once all chances are lost, or the time runs out the game is over. You will not get any extra chances during play.
